info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 3:28AM CDT until July 15 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coke and Nolan.
* WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain across Coke county, moving north at 25 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. These storms will move into southern Nolan county. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robert Lee, Blackwell, Nolan, Bronte, Sanco, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Silver, Fort Chadbourne, Maryneal, Hylton, Tennyson, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, Oak Creek Reservoir and The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
